t: Psalm 35
A Psalm of David.
Plead*p my cause, O Lord,*s with them that strive with me: fight against them that fight against me.
Take*p hold of shield and buckler, and stand up for mine help.
Draw*p out also the spear, and stop the way against them that persecute me: say unto my soul, I am thy salvation.
Let*p them be confounded and put to shame that seek after my soul: let them be turned back and brought to confusion that devise my hurt.
Let*p them be as chaff before the wind: and let the angel of the Lord*s chase them.
Let*p their way be dark and slippery: and let the angel of the Lord*s persecute them.
For*p without cause have they hid for me their net in a pit, which without cause they have digged for my soul.
Let*p destruction come upon him at unawares; and let his net that he hath hid catch himself: into that very destruction let him fall.
And*p my soul shall be joyful in the Lord:*s it shall rejoice in his salvation.
All*p my bones shall say, Lord,*s who is like unto thee, which deliverest the poor from him that is too strong for him, yea, the poor and the needy from him that spoileth him?
False*p witnesses did rise up; they laid to my charge things that I knew not.
They*p rewarded me evil for good to the spoiling of my soul.
But*p as for me, when they were sick, my clothing was sackcloth: I humbled my soul with fasting; and my prayer returned into mine own bosom.
I*p behaved myself as though he had been my friend or brother: I bowed down heavily, as one that mourneth for his mother.
But*p in mine adversity they rejoiced, and gathered themselves together: yea, the abjects gathered themselves together against me, and I knew it not; they did tear me, and ceased not:
With*p hypocritical mockers in feasts, they gnashed upon me with their teeth.
Lord,*p how long wilt thou look on? rescue my soul from their destructions, my darling from the lions.
I*p will give thee thanks in the great congregation: I will praise thee among much people.
Let*p not them that are mine enemies wrongfully rejoice over me: neither let them wink with the eye that hate me without a cause.
For*p they speak not peace: but they devise deceitful matters against them that are quiet in the land.
Yea,*p they opened their mouth wide against me, and said, Aha, aha, our eye hath seen it.
This*p thou hast seen, O Lord:*s keep not silence: O Lord, be not far from me.
Stir*p up thyself, and awake to my judgment, even unto my cause, my God and my Lord.
Judge*p me, O Lord*s my God, according to thy righteousness; and let them not rejoice over me.
Let*p them not say in their hearts, Ah, so would we have it: let them not say, We have swallowed him up.
Let*p them be ashamed and brought to confusion together that rejoice at mine hurt: let them be clothed with shame and dishonour that magnify themselves against me.
Let*p them shout for joy, and be glad, that favour my righteous cause: yea, let them say continually, Let the Lord*s be magnified, which hath pleasure in the prosperity of his servant.
And*p my tongue shall speak of thy righteousness and of thy praise all the day long.
